prompt: I just received an email with an invoice PDF attached. The invoice is from 'Tech Solutions Ltd' for web development services totaling $2,450.00, invoice number INV-2026-0234, dated February 15, 2026, due March 17, 2026. I need this processed and entered into my accounting system with proper validation and audit trail.
expectations: Extracts all key invoice fields (vendor, amount, dates, invoice number)
Validates the invoice data for completeness and accuracy
Checks due date is after invoice date
Creates proper audit trail entry with timestamp
Flags any uncertain extractions for review
Prepares data for accounting system entry
Suggests appropriate account codes for web development expense
Checks for duplicate invoice numbers from same vendor

files.name: invoice_tech_solutions.pdf
files.content:
INVOICE

Tech Solutions Ltd
123 Business Ave
San Francisco, CA 94105

Bill To:
Your Company Name

Invoice Number: INV-2026-0234
Invoice Date: February 15, 2026
Due Date: March 17, 2026

Description: Web Development Services
Quantity: 1
Rate: $2,450.00
Amount: $2,450.00

Subtotal: $2,450.00
Tax (8.5%): $208.25
Total: $2,658.25

prompt: I have a stack of receipts from a business trip that need to be processed for expense reimbursement. They include meals, taxi rides, and hotel stays. I need them categorized correctly, checked for tax deductibility rules, and prepared for my expense report system.
expectations: Processes multiple receipt types (meals, transportation, lodging)
Correctly categorizes each expense type
Applies appropriate tax deductibility rules (meals 50%, etc.)
Extracts key fields from each receipt (merchant, amount, date)
Validates dates and amounts for reasonableness
Calculates total reimbursable amounts by category
Flags any receipts that need manual review
Prepares summary report for expense submission

prompt: I need help with monthly bank reconciliation. I have the bank statement showing transactions and my accounting system has recorded entries. There seem to be some discrepancies that need to be identified and resolved. Can you help me match transactions and flag what needs manual review?
expectations: Processes bank statement data systematically
Attempts to match transactions between bank and accounting records
Identifies matched transactions with high confidence
Flags unmatched items for manual review
Calculates reconciliation differences
Suggests possible reasons for discrepancies
Creates clear reconciliation report
Maintains detailed audit trail of matching process

prompt: Set up my daily email monitoring system to automatically process financial documents. I want it to scan for invoices, receipts, and bank statements, extract key information, and organize everything for my review. Also set up alerts for urgent items like overdue payments.
expectations: Configures email monitoring rules and filters
Identifies financial document types in emails
Sets up automatic attachment processing
Creates document classification system
Establishes priority levels for different document types
Configures alert system for urgent items
Sets up organized filing system for processed documents
Creates daily summary reporting process

prompt: I need to prepare month-end financial reports. Can you help me compile all the transactions from February, categorize them properly, calculate totals by category, and generate a preliminary profit & loss statement? Also flag any unusual transactions that might need my attention.
expectations: Compiles all February transactions systematically
Categorizes transactions according to accounting principles
Calculates accurate totals for each category
Generates properly formatted P&L statement structure
Identifies and flags unusual or outlier transactions
Validates mathematical accuracy of all calculations
Provides clear summary of financial performance
Suggests areas that may need additional review
